intro: Aulomyrcia ramulosa, commonly known as the branched broom. It is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Brazil. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in dense inflorescences. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
